business.headline: Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares jumped 6% todayShares of IndusInd Bank were trading 5.51% higher at Rs 776.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) around 12:34 pm.

Over 3 million iPhones sold: Apple likely to post best-ever quarter in IndiaThe Q1 2025 number is a big jump from the 2.21 million iPhones sold in the same period last year. It shows how fast Apple is growing in India, a market that is becoming more important for the company every year.

Investment advisor warns against inflation: 'By 2030, you'll own less, pay more'Abhijit Chokshi stated in his post that most people think inflation means things getting expensive. But he explains that inflation has two faces. One is visible inflation and the other is invisible inflation.

PwC shuts down operations in more than a dozen countries: ReportThe decision was taken due to mounting differences with local partners. Local leaders at the firm said they lost over a third of their business in recent years after pressure from PwC's global executives to drop risky clients.

How Gensol promoter used company funds to buy ultra-luxury DLF Camellias flatDLF Camellias is a luxury housing project located in Sector 42, Gurgaon. It comprises 4 BHK, 5 BHK, and 6 BHK luxury apartments. Prices for these upscale homes begin at Rs 70 crore.
IREDA share price jumps 6% after strong Q4 results. All you need to knowIREDA shares jumped sharply after strong Q4 earnings, though asset quality concerns could temper gains in the near term.

Gensol Engineering share price crashes to all-time low. Should you buy or avoid?The stock has now crashed 84% since the start of 2025 and is down nearly 87% over the past year, making it one of the worst-performing listed firms in the clean energy space.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after 2-day tariff relief rally; Gensol shares tumble 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 84.98 points to 76,649.91 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.25 points to trade at 23,302.30. However, broader market indices did not see any major dip, and it is likely to provide relief to retail investors.
Gensol Engineering shares in focus today as Sebi takes action against promotersGensol Engineering shares have plunged 83% this year, and the market regulator's interim order may deepen the sell-off.

Sebi vs Jaggi brothers: What's in the interim order over wrongdoings?During its probe, the market regulator found 'blatant violation of rules of corporate governance' and 'alleged wrongdoings'.  It said that the promoters were running Gensol like a private firm.

Sebi bans Gensol's Jaggi brothers for diverting company funds for personal useSebi has passed an interim order barring promoters Anmol Singh Jaggi and Puneet Singh Jaggi from taking part in the securities market and from holding any position as directors or key managerial personnel in any listed company.

Government, Swiggy join hands to boost jobs in gig, delivery sectorThe government said the partnership with Swiggy would help take the National Career Service portal deeper into the gig economy space.

entertainment.headline: Malayalam, Marathi only industries delivering content: Mahesh ManjrekarVeteran filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar discusses the challenges faced by Marathi cinema despite its rich storytelling, highlighting the industry's struggle against big-budget Hindi films and the need for greater scale and reach.

Big B talks about importance of 'good sanskaar', value of time for new generationAmitabh Bachchan spoke about the significance of instilling 'good sanskaar' in the new generation. He emphasised the role of values and ethics in shaping the youth.

Renuka Shahane on Devmanus: Rare to find such simple yet powerful charactersRenuka Shahane returns to Marathi cinema with 'Devmanus', drawn by its compelling script and the unique simplicity of her character Lakshmi, whose spiritual journey anchors the narrative.

Adolescence season 2 in works? Actor Christine Tremarco answers | Exclusive 'Adolescence' actor Christine Tremarco discusses the show's ending and the uncertainty surrounding a potential second season in an exclusive interview with India Today/

Ananya Panday creates history as Chanel's first Indian brand ambassadorActor Ananya Panday attended the Chanel show at the Paris Fashion Week last year, and now, she has been announced as the first Indian brand ambassador of the French luxury brand.

AR Rahman breaks silence on recent health scare, personal life making headlinesAR Rahman discussed his recent health scare and the inspiration behind his upcoming 'Wonderment' tour in an exclusive chat with India Today. The music icon also reflected on personal life changes and the unwavering support from fans.

Sagarika Ghatge-Zaheer Khan become parents to baby boy, reveal nameActor Sagarika Ghatge and cricketer Zaheer Khan announced the birth of their son on Tuesday on Instagram. The couple shared a beautiful picture with their baby and also revealed his name in the caption.

It took Deepika Padukone for Ibrahim to realise his father Saif was 'big actor'Ibrahim Ali Khan got candid about growing up on film sets, and being raised by famous parents. In an interview recently, he talked about the moment he finally became aware of his father's popularity.

Alia Bhatt's lavish seven-course meal has the cutest Raha connectionLittle Raha, in an adorable gesture, prepared a 7-course meal for her mother Alia Bhatt. The heartwarming act was shared by Alia on social media, garnering much attention.

Jaat box office Day 6: Sunny Deol's film is Rs 53 crore strong during weekdaysSunny Deol's 'Jaat' is doing good business at the box office even on weekdays. The film has got two more days to enjoy an unchallenged run before Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari 2' hits the screens.

Prajakta Koli blasts magazine for claims about regretting marriage with VrishankPrajakta Koli has publicly challenged a magazine's claim that she regrets marrying her longtime boyfriend Vrishank Khanal. The content creator and actor clarified her stance on social media, dismissing the story as false.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 6: Rs 100 crore in Tamil Nadu, more records for AjithAjith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly' grossed over Rs 100 crore in Tamil Nadu, confirmed the makers. The film is expected to shatter more records.

Aamir Ali opens up about being sexually harassed at 14: Stopped taking trainsActor Aamir Ali has revealed a distressing experience from his teenage years when he faced sexual harassment. He recollected he was 14 when he was touched inappropriately.

Alex O'Nell on Phule controversy: Watch it and have a conversation | ExclusiveActor Alex O'Nell discusses the controversy surrounding the film 'Phule', which is a biopic about social reformers Jyotirao and Savitribai Phule, amidst objections from certain organisations.

Jaideep, Saif and others grooving to Jewel Thief song Jaadu is pure vibe. VideoThe Netflix heist-thriller 'Jewel Thief' is set to premiere on April 25. Ahead of its release, Nikita Dutta and Kunal Kapoor shared a fun behind-the-scenes clip from the promotions, where the cast is seen enjoying a light-hearted moment while grooving to the song 'Jaadu'.

Malayalam actor claims co-star insisted on fixing her dress on set: He was on drugsMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious revealed that her co-star, allegedly under the influence of drugs, insisted on fixing her dress. However, she did not name the person.

Emotional Rekha Gupta on Akshay Kumar's Kesari 2: Want to give more for motherlandDelhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was emotional after watching Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' at a special screening. Addressing the media, she said that the film was goosebumps-inducing.

Who is Cody John? Meet Emma Roberts' low-key actor fiancéEmma Roberts is engaged to actor Cody John, confirming the news on Instagram. The couple, together since 2022, keeps their relationship low-key, despite growing public interest in their romantic journey.
Ibrahim Ali Khan responds to dating rumours with Palak TiwariIbrahim Ali Khan has responded to rumours about his relationship with Palak Tiwari, describing her as a 'good friend'.

general news.headline: PM should rein in Amit Shah: Mamata Banerjee claims violence was plannedMamata Banerjee, in a meeting with imams over the Waqf law, suggested a conspiracy by Amit Shah and the BSF to allow the entry of Bangladeshi miscreants to fuel unrest in Bengal.

Temporary prisons for officers: Top court blasts Telangana over tree fellingThe Supreme Court lashed out at the Telangana government over large-scale tree felling in Kancha Gachibowli. Stressing on environmental restoration, the top court held officials accountable after reports of forest destruction near Hyderabad sparked outrage.

Gandhis key beneficiaries of Rs 5,000 crore assets: ED in National Herald caseIn the ED chargesheet, Sonia Gandhi has been named accused no 1, and Rahul as accused no 2. A special court will decide on taking cognisance of the chargesheet on April 25.

Chronically tired: A misunderstood illness affecting more women than menChronic fatigue syndrome is a complex, under-recognised illness that disproportionately affects women, yet often goes undiagnosed or misdiagnosed.

Air hostess on ventilator sexually assaulted by hospital staff in Gurugram: CopsThe case came to light after the 46-year-old air hostess registered a complaint alleging that she was sexually assaulted by hospital staff while unconscious and on a ventilator.

Priyanka Gandhi hugs Robert Vadra outside ED office as he returns for questioningPriyanka Gandhi, who accompanied her husband Robert Vadra for questioning in the Haryana land case, waited in the lobby of Enforecement Directorate headquarters.

Vellore waqf shocker shows why law didn't trigger CAA-like protestsThe arbitrary nature of land claimed as waqf properties was revealed in the notice served to 150 families in Tamil Nadu's Vellore by a mosque and dargah. Just a day earlier, PM Modi said how letters from Muslim widows triggered the waqf reforms. The arbitrariness of the claims, with even Muslims being victims, reveals why the anti-waqf law protests didn't take the shape or ferocity of the anti-CAA stir.

Bengaluru rehab patient dragged, beaten for refusing to wash warden's clothesA shocking video from a Bengaluru rehabilitation centre shows an inmate being violently beaten by staff for not obeying orders to wash clothes.

Language is not religion: Supreme Court upholds use of Urdu signboardThe top court described Urdu as the finest example of 'Ganga-Jamuni tehzeeb' and criticised prejudice against languages, calling such bias a "threat to India's cultural strength".

YouTuber kills husband with help of lover after he finds them in intimate actA woman, who is a YouTuber, was arrested on charges of killing her husband after he came to know about her affair with a man, who is also a YouTuber in Haryana's Bhiwani. The accused dumped the victim's body in a drain.

Waqf Amendment Act legal battle begins, Supreme Court to hear 73 petitions todayThe Supreme Court will on Wednesday hear 73 petitions challenging the constitutional validity of the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, on grounds ranging from alleged religious discrimination and executive overreach to dilution of Waqf protections.

Sagarika Ghatge-Zaheer Khan become parents to baby boy, reveal nameActor Sagarika Ghatge and cricketer Zaheer Khan announced the birth of their son on Tuesday on Instagram. The couple shared a beautiful picture with their baby and also revealed his name in the caption.

UP bride elopes with lover from beauty parlour, groom told she is deadIn a moment of embarrassment, the bride's family told the groom's side that she had died in a car accident on the way to the parlour.

26/11 turning point in India-Pak ties: S Jaishankar says Pak stuck in bad habitsOn November 26, 2008, a group of 10 Pakistani terrorists launched attacks at multiple locations in Mumbai, killing 166 persons in the nearly 60-hour siege.

Amid Trump's tariff war, China issues over 85,000 visas to 'Indian friends'China has issued over 85,000 visas to Indian citizens in 2025, significantly up from last year, amidst growing diplomatic tensions with the US over trade tariffs.

Madam will get AC removed now, modern cooling: Cow dung payback for DU principalA viral video showed the Delhi University Students' Union president smearing cow dung on the walls of Lakshmibai College Principal Pratyush Vatsala's office, days after the latter was seen doing the same in a classroom to "beat the heat".

Congress workers rally outside ED offices across states over action on GandhisA massive agitation was held at the Congress party office in Delhi, with hundreds of workers shouting slogans against the Centre and terming the action against the Gandhis 'political vendetta'.

Pakistani national kills two Telangana workers with sword at Dubai bakeryExpressing grief, Union Minister of State for Home Bandi Sanjay Kumar said he had spoken to MEA officials and that Union home ministry officials were in touch with them.

But once the whistle blew, Villa brought intensity, forcing PSG to dig deep to survive the quarter-final.

Making Riyan Parag RR stand-in captain over me was correct call: Nitish RanaNitish Rana said he had no issues with RR appointing Riyan Parag, the stand-in skipper, over him while Sanju Samson was recovering from injury. Riyan captained the Royals during the first 3 games of the season.

Yuzvendra Chahal (4/28) and Marco Jansen (3/17) were the stars of the show for Punjab, who defended the lowest ever score in IPL history.

Mirabhai Chanu elected as Wrestling Federation's Athletes Commission chairpersonTokyo Olympic medallist Mirabhai Chanu was elected as the Indian Wrestling Federation's Athletes Commission chairperson on Tuesday, April 15.

Rohit Sharma stand at Wankhede Stadium gets green light from Mumbai cricket bodyIndia captain Rohit Sharma will join the the likes of Sachin Tendulkar and Sunil Gavaskar in getting a stand named after him at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. The Mumbai Cricket Association approved a propsal for the same in its AGM on Tuesday, April 15.

Let them get banned: Mohit Sharma's hilarious take on bat size checks in IPLIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Senior fast bowler Mohit Sharma welcomed the BCCI's decision to check the size of the bats in the field of play. The fast bowler highlighted the lack of balance between bat and ball in modern-day T20s.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
